unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Logistics Delays Hamper Production**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Logistics Delays Hamper Production**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – Ongoing logistical disruptions are severely impacting manufacturers across India, causing significant delays and escalating costs. A recent survey by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) reveals that delays at ports and increased transportation times are major contributors.
normalised: New Delhi, India – Ongoing logistical disruptions are severely impacting manufacturers across India, causing significant delays and escalating costs. A recent survey by the Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I) reveals that delays at ports and increased transportation times are major contributors.

unnormalised: “The situation is reminiscent of the traffic jams depicted in ‘Bombay to Goa’,” commented Rohan Sharma, head of operations at a Mumbai-based textile mill, referencing the classic Bollywood comedy. “While amusing on screen, the reality is costing us dearly. We're seeing delays of up to 2 weeks on shipments coming from Gujarat, adding Rs. 50,000 to our expenses per truck.”
normalised: “The situation is reminiscent of the traffic jams depicted in ‘Bombay to Goa’,” commented Rohan Sharma, head of operations at a Mumbai-based textile mill, referencing the classic Bollywood comedy. “While amusing on screen, the reality is costing us dearly. We're seeing delays of up to two weeks on shipments coming from Gujarat, adding rupee fifty thousand to our expenses per truck.”

unnormalised: Specifically, bottlenecks at Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust (JNPT) and increased domestic freight demand are cited as primary causes. The Indian Institute of Logistics Management is reportedly working with the Ministry of Commerce to identify long-term solutions, including optimizing rail connectivity and streamlining customs procedures.
normalised: Specifically, bottlenecks at Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust (J N P T) and increased domestic freight demand are cited as primary causes. The Indian Institute of Logistics Management is reportedly working with the Ministry of Commerce to identify long-term solutions, including optimizing rail connectivity and streamlining customs procedures.

unnormalised: The delays are also impacting the export of finished goods, with some companies reporting difficulties in meeting international deadlines. Some shipments are also delayed because of the heavy rainfall across the state of Kerala. The average transportation cost has risen to 2.5 Rs. per km.
normalised: The delays are also impacting the export of finished goods, with some companies reporting difficulties in meeting international deadlines. Some shipments are also delayed because of the heavy rainfall across the state of Kerala. The average transportation cost has risen to two point five rupees per kilometer.
